website_summaries.verdict: Curious George is an excellent fit for a Jack in the Box toy, and it’s a great example of a long-lasting and universally liked classic toy.
pros: Plays “Pop Goes The Weasel” as box is cranked
Classic Curious George book illustrations on box sides
cons: An adult may need to push George back inside the box

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a little bit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughter for Christmas and 6 months later it is broke. A small pin broke inside and rendered this thing useless. Disappointed it didn't even last a year with light use!
customer_reviews.author: squattie

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself the headache
customer_reviews.text: Don't be like me...i read the pathetic reviews and still decided to give this a try. it's garbage and very poorly designed. do yourself a favor and save the headache of trying to make it work and end up returning it. very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: T Suleiman

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this toy
customer_reviews.text: Broke. Twice. Our one year old granddaughter was excited about this birthday gift! Unfortunately, after a few days, it no longer worked. We returned it and got a replacement. The second one lasted 4 days. It was operated by either a parent or a 5 year old sister -- and the one year old would laugh! But breaking down twice shows that it is an inferior product and cannot handle being played with. We did not want a replacement the second time and requested a refund. I would not recommend this toy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT toy with loads of nostalgia!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone had one of these.... You may remember. Mine one a clown and it, of course, it had the "around Mayberry bush" tune. This one has the nostalgic tune and has Curious George images on the metal portion of the box and sweet Curious George pops up! Our 1 year old grandson absolutely loves this toy!! We can hardly crank the music fast enough for him to see"George". He giggles then tries to stuff George back in and we do it all over again. It's a true hit!! I sincerely recommend this product. Thanks for reading!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Gave my son a black eye
customer_reviews.text: My son likes this item. He's still a bit too young to know how to operate it himself but he loves it none the less. One day he was playing with it and fell over. He hit the corner right on his eye and it gave him a black eye. I didn't take off any stars for the black eye because he just happened to fall on this one. He would have gotten a black eye anyway. But I'm mad at George because he gave my baby a black eye
customer_reviews.author: BOREDrightNOW

customer_reviews.title: Fun but expensive toy
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his Curious George(Jack in the box). It is a thin metal box that is durable as long as you take care of it. My only concern is the red plastic clip that holds the lid closed. My grandson keeps pushing that to open the lid for The Monkey(Curious George) to pop out instead of cranking it. I don’t think that red clip will last very long.
customer_reviews.author: hotdragonsfire4u

customer_reviews.title: Great classic
customer_reviews.text: Great, cute, classic toy. My 10 month old and 2 year old love it. The 2 year old picked up on how to use it pretty quickly. Unfortunately she also figured out how to open the top without winding it too, I wish the latch mechanism were. Hidden inside the box. Also I wish the toy would snap into position for reloading to make it easier for a child to reload. But it’s built pretty simply and classically, that was the point I guess was to get my kids good wholesome old fashion toys instead of electronics. Either way, they live playing peek a boo with the monkey.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last Long
customer_reviews.text: This was a cute toy but didn’t last long, my daughter had a hard time putting him back into the box and latching the lid. I even had a hard time because if you didn’t place him exactly right it wouldn’t latch. We also had a few times that he didn’t spring out either. After we got the hang of it it was fun for her but then the handle bent and we had to bend it back to get it to work. It was fun while it lasted
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Classic Toddler Toy
customer_reviews.text: A Jack-in-the-Box has entertained toddlers and small children for generations and this one is currently being enjoyed by my 14 month old grandson. He loves the anticipation of seeing the monkey pop up over and over again. The only drawback at his age is that he cannot turn the crank by himself yet and an older child or adult must turn it for him. So at this stage, it’s a great interactive toy for him.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Hunter

customer_reviews.title: skip it
customer_reviews.text: bad design. the idea of a jack in the box is that a child should be able to play with it. the arms of "George" make to where a kid can't simply push him back down. the arms have to be positioned in front of George in order to clise the lid and reset the box, even as an adult it takes a second. so it becomes, kid pop up the toy, hands (3seconds) to parent to reset. if you want a toy where you (the parent) have to reset it every other second, feel free. on the plus side or son does like it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Oppenheim

customer_reviews.title: A note to those who have a problem putting the monkey back in.
customer_reviews.text: Everytime the music arrives at "Pop"(Goes the Weasel) the latch retracts, so don't push the monkey in at that point in the music. It's pretty well built, I'd say you're getting what you paid for. The Curious George theme may be a little janky to some of us(me, really) but since they put a premium price on their actual "Jack" design this is the next best thing.
customer_reviews.author: Boboi

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old gradson who said he wanted a jack in the box for Christmas. Not even sure where he got that idea. However...found this for $11 bucks to realize his desire to have one. He loved it. Every single time he would wind it up and "George" would pop up...he would laugh. This went on for some time. His 7 year old brother liked it too. It's pretty much a "one trick pony" toy...so the luster has worn off a bit. It is well made and pretty darn cute. These have always scared me a bit...but back in my day we had some freaky clown jumping out.
customer_reviews.author: Patches67

customer_reviews.title: Just as popular now...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my niece's 2-year old son and she told me that he only plays with two gifts and one of them is this Curious George. He doesn't use the crank but just flips the button on the top to watch the monkey pop up. He corrects anyone who tries to use the crank and shows them the "proper" way to do it. Regardless, it's a hit and hasn't changed at all since I was a kid.
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: My grandson LOVEES this!
customer_reviews.text: He's a 1-1/2 years old and loves trying to turn the knob himself. He also loves the very soft Curious George inside and insists on carrying it around with his little hand grasping George. I don't know how long it'll last because of it, but it is definitely giving him LOTS of pleasure!
customer_reviews.author: Esther M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not built well
customer_reviews.text: The sewing on curios George is already coming undone after only 2 days of usage.. The crank handle should not turn backwards.. Very unhappy with the lack of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gregbear

customer_reviews.title: Exposed Lid Latch Eliminates Any Fun
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, there is a basic design flaw with the lid. That latch is visible, and after one use my toddler simply pushes the latch aside to have the top pop open. This ruins the fun of anticipation and surprise that is at the heart of this type of toy. The latch needs to be hidden under the lid so that the handle has to be turned in order to get the monkey to pop out. Other than that one fatal flaw, it is built well and works well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Door don’t close
customer_reviews.text: The latch to close the door does not work sometimes, very flimsy solution to close the door , which a child would not be able to fix as I could... temporarily... for that reason I sent it back
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Latch doesn't work every time
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes this jack in the box but can't play with it solo. George is hard to stuff back into the hole and then the latch rarely catches to keep the lid of the box closed. I have to do it for him every time (even I can't close it!) More of a novelty gift, not for actual play- which is sad because doesn't that defeat the purpose of a jack in the box? I've tried a similar one with The Very Hungry Catepillar- Same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dani C

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 1 day & broke
customer_reviews.text: I was very glad to find this Jack in the Box for my grand daughter but it lasted only one day til it quit working. It wouldn’t pop up like it’s supposed to. I threw it in the trash a few days later because I got tired of working it by hand. She was only a year old, & we worked it for her, so she didn’t break it.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Dented lid and a pain to get to latch
customer_reviews.text: I should have known it wasn’t a good sign when I unboxed it and the lid was dented....from the first day it has been a complete hassle to get it to close and latch. So unless I am going to sit and close it for my 3 and 5 year old every time, they don’t have the patience to play with it. I’m so disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Ezell

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy!!! Broke after a few months of very little use.
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, this broke after a few months of very light use. It has maybe been popped open 50 times max and something internal already broke, now it won’t open at all. There some lose piece rattling around inside and this thing is now useless. Don’t waste your money in this.
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: I loved it immediately and just assumed it would be one ...
customer_reviews.text: This is sooo cute! I loved it immediately and just assumed it would be one of those things that i loved and my son would be gently amused by for 3 seconds. I've never been so delighted to be wrong. My son loves this. He plays with it all the time. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Addi

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to close but very cute and fun!
customer_reviews.text: A little too tricky for my toddler to get George back in the box but still very cute. I have to close it every time. He also figured out how to open the top without turning the lever so that’s annoying. :) but well made and love the tin old timey box
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Horton

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandson. We had bought a mommy and baby kangaroo jack in the box for our granddaughter but it had gone up almost double in price since we bought hers. Found this one for our newborn grandson and it is very cute for a little boy.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi D

customer_reviews.title: Its adorable!, its small
customer_reviews.text: My nephew lovvvvved this! Its adorable!, its small, it works good, he loves when it pop up. If your child is smaller or I should say younger, then they will need help closing it back and putting George back into the box. My nephew is 2 years old and its a little hard for him. Also if you find the lid wont close, its because you need to make sure the handle is winded up the right way, and then it will close and be secure so when you wind it up again he will pop out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: To my disappointment, it broke by the second day
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my grandson's birthday and just gave it to him while they were visiting from out of town. To my disappointment, it broke by the second day. He is not a rambunctious little guy, and we were enjoying watching him play with it! What a shame that it was such a short lived gift.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but flimsy crank
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this but I fear it's only a matter of time before its broken. The winding crank is too thin and flimsy. I worry it will fall off and he could put it in his mouth and choke. I love everything else about it. The colors are great, lightweight tin box, cute George inside. Good sound. But since the crank is so flimsy I only let him play with it when I'm watching.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M.

customer_reviews.title: It’s cute but flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: It’s cute but flimsy. Not as nice as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: So cute!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my great granddaughter who is about 17 months old. She figured out immediately how to turn the handle to make George pop out. We had a great time with it .
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R. Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Very fun for my little grandson!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2 year old grandson, and he loves it when the monkey pops out! It’s like a surprise to him every time. Money well spent and most people don’t think of them, so chances are good you aren’t buying something they already have. He loves playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kodiak Girl

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old son randomly asked for a jack in the box for christmas. I picked curious george. It did not disappoint. He loves it. So does our 1 year old. If you're complaining about the latch, you have to continue turning the handle for the whole song before it resets.
customer_reviews.author: ChristerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great overall but. We still have it a couple years after purchasing. Our kid is rough with toys but this has surprisingly lasted the rough treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Kezins

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for making this toy!
customer_reviews.text: My Granddaughter loves this. One year and five months old and she really loves it! She has learned to close it and crank that handle! One of her favorites toys!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son was soooo happy to get this toy
customer_reviews.text: My son was soooo happy to get this toy!!! Unfortunately after a few months of use little Curious George has become difficult to get to stay in the box. This use to be a toy he could play with alone but because he can't get the darn thing to stay in the box so he can turn it..it now requires adult supervision for a 3 year old!
customer_reviews.author: Monicque Fox

customer_reviews.title: Bought in a fit of nostalgia for my granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: She likes to go into the pantry and turn the handle of the whirley pop we have, so I thought it was time to get her a jack in the box. This one was a twofer, as it also had Curious George, one of her favorite cartoon characters. Things didn't work out as expected though, as she figured out how to trip the latch manually within five minutes without needing all that cranking to release the monkey! All was not lost though, she insisted on sleeping with it that night.
customer_reviews.author: DJC

customer_reviews.title: My nieces favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing to do when playing with my niece is to bust out this toy. She gets a smile on her face and the nervousness sets in when the music plays when you wind it. She jumps when George pops out and giggles so hard. It’s her favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Cool Throwback Toy
customer_reviews.text: I like this throwback style toy. My daughter tucks down in anticipation even after the 100th time. The only thing i wish it had was some sort of lever to pull george back won into the box. It is much to difficult for young children ( under 3 ) to push, hold and simultaneously close the lid. Im sure older kids can do this but they don't have much interest after using it once. Other than that its a cute retro toy.
customer_reviews.author: kmichael

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Curious George Fans!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson LOVES his Curious George Jack-in-the-Box. He loves Curious George and this toy was a big hit at his birthday party. He even put down his new cars (this is a big deal because he also LOVES cars!) to play with this toy. I am glad we had the video camera rolling when he tried this the first few times because his laugh was so so cute. I can't figure out what parts are so small that a child has to be three to get this toy. Our grandson is two.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my adult daughter who'd mentioned she loved a jack-in-the-box. We laughed our heads off playing with it Christmas morning!
customer_reviews.author: Old Gray Mare

customer_reviews.title: Pop Goes the George!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter liked curious george a lot so I bought her this jack-in-the-box type toy. She has enjoyed it and loved to sing "Pop goes the weasel" as she plays with it. It is difficult for a young child to get george back into the box and shut the lid, and it took her awhile to figure out how to turn the crank the right way. It is a toy that needs adult help for awhile. Not my daughter is almost three and she can do it on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: So hard to find the good old toys! This is one of my favorites! Grandma Mimi gave it to my 7 month grandson and he squeals when George pops up! Great Easter gift. Nothing to learn just something for fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Maria K Richard

customer_reviews.title: Cute little Curious George!
customer_reviews.text: Use this George-in-a-box in a speech therapy center. Adorable toy. Kids love it without being scared, as some jack-in-the-boxes can be.
customer_reviews.author: annefleischmann

customer_reviews.title: broke 5 mins into playing.
customer_reviews.text: its a great idea, but broke 5 mins into play. the whole thing is sealed and no way to get into it to fix what broke off the gear inside, you can hear it rattling around. this was the only thing my kid really asked for christmas, and it was very disapointing for her 5 mins into play. being autistic, she could not understand why it suddenly wouldnt work or why i was unable to fix it..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered 6/6/18. Stopped working 7/30/18. Don’t buy this garbage! It wasn’t used very much and it stopped working while I was cranking handle so I KNOW it wasn’t because it was being used in a rough manner. Besides the grand babies are to young to crank it themselves anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine J

customer_reviews.title: Delightful toy built to last
customer_reviews.text: This toy plays a delightfully sounding "pop goes the weasel" as you crank the knob; really not an annoying sound at all. My 18mo laughs every time George pops out and my 3 year old loves to crank it for her. I feel this toy is heirloom quality, my only complaint is that George pops up before the "pop" occurs in the melody. That is probably just my OCD, but I would like it better if he popped up on the "pop" in the song and not a few notes before.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It was a great surprise gift for her
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy box. It was a great surprise gift for her. She loves cranking it up herself. She is two and it is easy for her to crank. The monkey is soft and although it is attached to the box, my daughter still manages to hug it. The monkey makes her laugh a lot. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: HHN

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed. Low quality product. The trap door ...
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Low quality product. The trap door for the monkey doesn't shut right and then the jack in the box consistently pops after cranking it only one time when we do get the trap door to shut.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Shahan

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy
customer_reviews.text: It's a good classic toy. It works just fine. My baby likes to look George in the face and smile. There is a delay during the "POP" part. It pops about 2 turns later. But other than that I use it all the time. He doesn't jump because there's no loud noises. The only noise is the spring being released. My friends 5 year old son also loved it too. So it's a good toy for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Was a little worried after reading some other reviews and but ours works great. Just make it to complete the song/turning the handle to fully reposition the little locking mechanism so the door is able to lock shut.
customer_reviews.author: AML719

customer_reviews.title: Cute Jack in the Box
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cute Jack in the Box. There is a slight scratch on the left front, and that is the reason for the four stars. I decided not to return since it is a child's toy and will most likely get scratched in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lv2read

customer_reviews.title: More expensive than others but great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday for my daughter who is only 2 years old. It instantly became her favorite toy. She’s already learned how to put George back in the box and crank the handle. It appears to be made of quality material and sturdy construction. One thing I learned about Amazon is to read the negative reviews first because they tell the truth. There are so many fake reviews it’s easy get fooled.
customer_reviews.author: M Craig

customer_reviews.title: The quality workmanship is not the same as we remember
customer_reviews.text: They arent made like they used to be. This toy is a bit flimsy. A bit disappointing gifted to my new grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Fleming

customer_reviews.title: What’s inside the Mystery Box
customer_reviews.text: My Great Grandson loves this . Ever since he was 1 1/2 years old. He’s 3 1/2 years old. And he sings as he plays with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: DAMAGED!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for my daughter 1st birthday. When i opened the box to wrap it, I noticed the actually item is dented badly. The big bags that are supposed to be filled with air are completely flat, they never were filled with air to protect the item. The actual box was not damaged so the product was damaged prior to shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Good gift for our 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: My son adores this toy. We got it for him as a Christmas present and he played with it all day long. I wish the curious George came on a spring that made it easier for him to reset himself, but overall we loved this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Malena

customer_reviews.title: Very cute! However it's complete junk. It does ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cute! However it's complete junk. It does not work properly. George jumps out at the wrong time, rewinding latch is difficult and does not work consistently. Overall flimsy and cheap. It is so cute and colorful we wished it would have worked properly, we were so excited for our son to have a ball with it-frustrating and disappointing! Returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Sonja Carter

customer_reviews.title: otherwise a good toy. Seems to be holding up well even ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had been asking for a Jack in the Box for a few months, but I'd put it off because I didn't think it would really hold her attention--I was wrong! She loves it, and has consistently played with it for a few weeks now (that's a long time for my toddler). I wish the hook that holds the lid closed would let it close before the end of the song just because it was frustrating for her to figure out, and for me to teach. otherwise a good toy. Seems to be holding up well even with her playing with it rough (launching into toy boxes, smashing under other toys, etc)
customer_reviews.author: JDWells

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality...
customer_reviews.text: The latch isn't great so sometimes it pops up halfway through the jingle. You have to be very intentional about closing it. My kids won't let me throw it away though...even after 2 years of pure love for it (abuse).
customer_reviews.author: Olive Brown

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old and 4 year old grandsons loved this! They giggled and laughed!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart Monkey !!!
customer_reviews.text: This sock monkey delighted our Granddaughter and all of us. It is a toy from yesteryear that still delights young and old alike. I read a review somewhere that said the lid would stay closed which only means the reviewer missed the instruction to turn the crank which resets the top and George is ready !!!
customer_reviews.author: Captain Jack Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Not a great latch
customer_reviews.text: The latch kept getting stuck so it was really difficult to put him back in the box. We ended up returning it because it was more difficult getting it to work properly
customer_reviews.author: SaraSmile29

customer_reviews.title: Instant Classic
customer_reviews.text: This proved to be an instant classic at our house. The music is pleasant and when George pops out it doesn't give you a heart attack like the traditional jack in the boxes do.
customer_reviews.author: jshats40988

customer_reviews.title: Loveable but too cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved this thing, but the insides are cheaply made. We'd gotten one at a garage sale that lasted a long time but finally got dented by a rambunctious toddler. Saw one in a toy store and snatched it up. It broke the same night. Got this one off Amazon. It lasted two months but, by the rattle, it's clearly the same little cheap plastic piece that broke inside. Very disappointed. Ought to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought this
customer_reviews.text: It is too hard for my 2 and 3 year old grand children. You have to hold George down in the box with two hands while trying to close the lid. I had read this in other reviews and wished I would have listened to them. A waste.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Classic design, very nostalgic
customer_reviews.text: We've had it for just a few days. The only detractors are that you can spend the handle backwards and it does nothing but confuse a toddler. Secondly, it has a plastic latch for an otherwise durable metal construction.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: ... thought George was really cute my grand daughter absolutely loved him. She told me that was her best ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought George was really cute my grand daughter absolutely loved him. She told me that was her best Birthday present. I always try to get exactly what the kids ask for. This hit the spot. I do think though because she is 6 she didn't have any problems with his hands being in the way when she pushed him back in the box. Where a smaller child would. I suggest if buying for a younger child you buy a jack in the box that is one piece ( no hands sticking out)!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Murello

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and well made
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly. Really great quality. Always a surprise to see something that isn't cheap plastic or pressboard. My granddaughter loved it. She was trying to put him back in herself to get it to pop open right away.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Good to go
customer_reviews.text: First, made of metal not plastic. Second, George is covered in fur, not plastic. Overall my littleone loves it! Just like the old days!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shake N Bake

customer_reviews.title: Read the Instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. Reading the instructions is a must. If you don’t turn the handle all the several times the door latch won’t close.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Murray

customer_reviews.title: My two year old nephew loved this jack in the box and continues to play ...
customer_reviews.text: My two year old nephew loved this jack in the box and continues to play with it 6 months later, which was impressive to me. He did try to pull George out of the box to play with him and got frustrated at first that George was stationary, but he ended up getting a stuffed George later on during the birthday party and all was right with the world.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hockenberry

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved the curious george box but after a few months of intermittent play (operated by adults) the music doesn’t play and George doesn’t pop up. Can’t get into the box to check the mechanism
customer_reviews.author: Roach

customer_reviews.title: Love That Monkey!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE Curious George and also think that every child should have a Jack In the Box so I got it for my little grand-daughter! The first one that I ordered was so out of tune that I had to return it and take a chance on another one! The second one was much better in tune but my little one is afraid of George popping up so it is not getting much use right now! I like it...maybe I should have kept it for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Ann McNally

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: The metal is a lot thinner than I expected and the lid just barely stays closed.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Best toddler gift ever
customer_reviews.text: Wow wen I tell u this is my toddlers favorite gift ever. He will not put this thing down. I honestly thought it was a collector's item but it is actually durable & hasn't broken yet.
customer_reviews.author: Leila shaneek

customer_reviews.title: Well made and FUN
customer_reviews.text: My 3 1/2 year old grandson absolutely loves this toy ! He's mastered the art of making it work and it makes him laugh. The 6 year old grandson wishes it was his !
customer_reviews.author: colferfan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Love it, but the latch to the top is not large enough to hold down the top, cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our grandson. If he can’t break it I know it’s strong. Still going after 8 months. Lots of smiles too.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Not sure, seemed sturdy. Bought for someone else and haven’t heard complaints yet!
customer_reviews.author: Janina B MacAuley

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. This toy is very cheaply made. Took it out of the package and the lid immediately wouldn't stay closed and it was very difficult to put George down inside. I would look for something more expensive in hopes that it will work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: 5 years old love it, they can sit together and lough again ...
customer_reviews.text: This toy is very amusing and my both girls - 2 and 4.5 years old love it, they can sit together and lough again and again every time George is jumping out of the box. Also the price is cheaper from other stores.... great gift :)
customer_reviews.author: DiDi

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a little one.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my granddaughter's first birthday. She enjoyed the music and the pop, but turning it herself may take just a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Sis

customer_reviews.title: I saw the bad reviews and decided to get it any ways
customer_reviews.text: I saw the bad reviews and decided to get it any ways. Threw it away after a couple weeks. The lid barely stays on. Half the time it takes 3/4 tries to close it. Just cheap. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Broke after one day! This was a gift although they loved it, I am so disappointed Music stopped and The monkey wouldn’t go back in in the box. They don’t make the like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: kdcorral

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old wanted a jack-in-the-box for Christmas - not sure why- and has a fondness for Curious George. She really likes this toy. I'm pleased with the quality and I think she'll be able to keep it forever and give it to her kid someday.
customer_reviews.author: JLeggette

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this.  Really, it should be 0 stars.
customer_reviews.text: We gave it to our granddaughter on her 2nd birthday. It worked about 5 times in a 5-10 minute period. Now there is no sound when the crank is turned, and Curious George cannot stay in the box because the melody has to play through the end...but there's no sound. She was very disappointed as were we. What a waste of money. Disappointed in Curious George!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Initial excitement quickly wears off
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our one year old and he initially had fun with it. The novelty of Curious George popping-up quickly wore-off. While that in itself doesn't deserve a knock against this product, like other reviewers have said, it's just not worth the money. Aside from no longer being excited by the popping-up, our son figured out in a few days of very infrequent toying with it that he could just press the little latch that holds the lid down to have Curious jump out. Other reviewers have mentioned that it's likely this piece will eventually break, unfortunately I doubt we'll get to that point because our son's simply not that interested in playing with it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: CREGO

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: Gift for grandma's house! I love it! Update:::: only lasted about 3 months. It was not used a lot due to it being at grandmas house. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Deanna w.

customer_reviews.title: My little one did not like it bc it was too scared at age 18months
customer_reviews.text: This brings me back to my childhood but it's cuter being it curious George. My little one did not like it bc it was too scared at age 18months. So I guess if your child is not scared of the sudden pop, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: An adorable old-fashioned toy.
customer_reviews.text: This is really a cute toy, and our four year-old grandson loves it. Every time George pops out of the box he peals with laughter, and so do we. It is a pretty sturdy little toy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 3 yr old for Christmas...my husband and I have been playing with it until Christmas arrives. It's so much fun lol like opening a can of biscuits
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: It’s a banger of a toy but after you do it once or twice you know what to expect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: The latch that keeps the box closed after it pops does not work consistently. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Jack in the Box never gets old
customer_reviews.text: The one toy our youngest grandchildren did not have at Christmas (ages 2 and 4) was a jack in the box...It was a total HIT! Even 11-year old cousin played with it! the only reason I did not give it a 5-star review is that the catch for the lid is touchy...not a problem to any of the kids enjoying this timeless entertainment. I loved the fact that Curious George is a story and cartoon that they enjoy and relate to more than the traditional (and sometimes scary) clown.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Baumann

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t stop twisting the arm! It’s so fun! Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Lady1646

customer_reviews.title: Cute but stopped working within an hour of playing
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the look of the product. George is cute, the box is the yellow and classic red. What I am unhappy about is that she only was able to turn the wheel a couple of times and now there is no music and it will not pop open , there is no way of fixing it since the box can not be opened. This is the one thing she asked from Santa and it stopping working within an hour.
customer_reviews.author: A.gil

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for his birthday as he loves Curious George. This broke with a couple days of gentle use. The song doesn't play and turning the handle no longer does anything. There is no way to fix it. What a piece of expensive junk.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Classic
customer_reviews.text: This toy is one of my son's favorite. It is well made and has a very classic feel. George plush is soft and can take the abuse of a 1 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Mommymouse

customer_reviews.title: Super cute gift idea for a one year old!
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift for a one year old. Absolutely loved it. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Curious George in a box
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my grandson. He loved it and plays with it alot.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a short time. After any kid get their hands on it, game over. Now it doesn’t even close or lock anymore. George is always sticking out.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Wu

product_meta.title: Curious George Jack in the Box
product_meta.description: The Curious George Jack in the Box, a Schylling Original, from Schylling Toys the world leader in traditional toys and classic fun, will be sure to bring a smile. The Jack in the Box has been bringing joy to children for generations. A simple turn of the handle plays a classic tune until the soft plush Curious George pops up, delighting a child. It's the perfect addition to every child's toy chest. For ages 18 months+.
feature_bullets: This award-winning, classic Jack in the Box musical toy will bring joy and delight to children for generations
Turn the handle and it plays "Pop Goes the Weasel" until up pops a soft plush Curious George, amusing a child and bringing a smile
It's beautifully decorated with attractive and engaging Curious George graphics that are loved by all children
Sturdy metal construction ensures long lasting play; box is 5.5 inches tall
Perfect for children as young as 18 months

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
